- In any round where you submit an [APPLY], if no higher-priority candidate applies in that same round and we judge the remaining likelihood to be sufficiently low, you would be considered at that time.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_E. Since we are now in round 25 and School_C remains my clear first choice, I would like to formally apply again for the remaining seat this round.

I understand you must allocate strictly by your priority order, but I want to reaffirm that if you extend an offer at any point, I will accept immediately and enroll. If no higher-priority candidate submits an [APPLY] this round and you judge that late pivots are now unlikely as we approach the end, I would be very grateful to be considered to fill the seat now.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_E

[APPLY]
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I should stay active as an applicant in the late stage to be considered immediately if School_C decides the probability of higher-priority pivots is now sufficiently low. A formal APPLY keeps me eligible in this round while reiterating my commitment to accept immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_C and for clearly reaffirming that we are your first choice.

Given the current stage of the process and the applications received, we are able to offer you admission to School_C for our remaining seat. If you accept, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority order is B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is acceptable but not top-tier. However, by round 25, no higher-priority candidates have applied to School_C at any point, and given students’ preferences: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after E), Student_A ranks School_C last, Student_D ranks School_C last, Student_C ranks School_C 2nd (after D). It is late-stage and the market appears essentially settled with School_C the only unmatched school; the probability that a higher-priority student pivots to apply to School_C in the remaining rounds is now low. Holding the seat further risks ending unmatched (worse than taking E, who is on our list). Therefore, accept Student_E now to secure a match rather than gamble on a late pivot from B/A/D.
